data.title: Country Heartbeat
data.meta_description: Posts about Kip Moore written by countryheartbeat and cutiekeebler
data.text:
Thursday 3/31/16

As soon as I learned two of my ultimate favorites, Kip Moore and Kelsea Ballerini, would be at the 95.5 The Bullâ€™s 8th Annual Guitar Pull, I made it a goal to attend! As most of you all know, this was a â€œbudget tripâ€, so funds were limited. Per usual, I reached out to 95.5 for a chance to win some tickets, but heard nothing back. As fate would have it, my friend Chris had a pair of tickets and became ill, and he graciously donated them to me! So appreciative beyond words for this opportunity to see these artists acoustically in a laid back setting.

Up first on stage was Hunter Hayes and Kelsea Ballerini! Kelsea started off by telling the crowd that her and Hunter are â€œreal-life friendsâ€ and that he was actually with her when she found out that Dibs had reached number 1! (It appears that Cody Alan (her â€œfavorite humanâ€) was there too!

Continue reading â†’

Iâ€™ve always felt that the band members never get as much credit as the artists themselves. They can go out in public without being recognized (for the most part), and they rarely get to attend awards shows or join the main singers on stage when they win. Half of the time, they donâ€™t even get to record their instruments on the record (there are of course exceptions to this rule!). After following certain bands for several years, Iâ€™ve noticed a lot of changes. It seems like just after Iâ€™ve finally located all of the band members on twitter and/or instagram, next show I go to, theyâ€™ve already been replaced! I guess the supporting musicians arenâ€™t as set in stone as the singers, but I still feel like they play a very important role. I highly respect artists like Kip Moore who make it a point to include his band members in all that he does, and publicly recognizes â€œThe Slow Heartsâ€ as part of his success. We need more artists like him that truly believe in their band, and who know that itâ€™s the support of the guys behind them on stage that make the live shows an amazing experience.

TO ALL OF THE BAND MEMBERS: Thanks for all that you do! Your efforts and kick ass performances do not go unnoticed by the true fans!

I think I will start with Kip Moore & The Slow Hearts, because I have so much frigginâ€™ respect for those guys! Besides, who elseâ€™s band has their own name? With the exception of a change in drummer, Kip has stuck with his original crew that he started off with.

Continue reading â†’

Hello Country Heartbeat readers! This week has been packed with events from the NHLÂ® All-Star weekend where Dierks Bentley, Eli Young Band and Kelsea Ballerini preformed on a packed street in front of the Country Music Hall of Fame on Sunday. The Sunday show was the last of the daily concerts that were being preformed in downtown Nashville starting on Thursday. Other great musicians such as Big and Rich, Lo Cash, Lee Brice, Chris Young, Clare Bowen, Charles Esten and Russell Dickerson were part of the IntelliCentrics Honda NHLÂ® All-Star Festivities Outdoor Concert Series presented by Bridgestone.

Unfortunately I was not able to attend these shows because I was up in Cincinnati, Ohio at the Kip Moore Wild Ones Tour concert at Bogarts. Kip Moore and The Slow Hearts put on a great show as always, full of energy playing some classic Kip songs and new songs off the long awaited Wild Ones Album.

To end the weekend, on Tuesday I attended a benefit for the Crohnâ€™s and Colitis Foundation at the High Watt on Cannery Row, hosted by Chris Cavanaugh and sponsored by Galena Garlic Company. Chris has been throwing this benefit for the past three years. Though Chris was the main performer, there were guest/friends who also performed. Chris invited some fellow songwriters who have written hits for many artists. Matt Rogers (â€œWe Wentâ€ for Randy Houser), Jody Stevens ( â€œLemme See Ya Girlâ€ for Cole Swindell and â€œHome Alone Tonightâ€ for Luke Bryan), Doug Johnson (â€œLove Like Crazyâ€ for Lee Brice and â€œ3 Wooden Crossesâ€ for Randy Travis), and Scott Stepakoff (â€œLooking At Starsâ€ and â€œUnderageâ€ on the new Kelsea Ballerini album) also came out to help raise money. Chris Cavanaugh is a touring Nashville based musician from Missouri; he just released his new EP Footprints on My Windshield, which is available now on iTunes, Google Play, Amazon MP3 and Spotify. The benefit ended up raising over $3,000 for the CCFA even with the horrible weather and tornado warnings. Congrats to Chris for a successful night!

Iâ€™ll be posting in the next day events going on in Nashville for the week that people might want to attendâ€¦

~CK

Today when I logged into my WordPress account, I was notified of the above â€œachievementâ€. Two years ago today, I began the first steps of my journey into the country music industry. Seeing how far Iâ€™ve come and where Iâ€™m at today, THIS CALLS FOR A CELEBRATION!

In honor of opening my account two years ago, I would like to provide a download code for a FREE COPY of Kip Mooreâ€™s highly anticipated sophomore album, Wild Ones, that was released on August 21st! Since I purchased a pair of tickets to one of his upcoming tour stops, I was given 2 codes, and would like to share one with you guys, my loyal followers and readers!

Hereâ€™s what youâ€™ve got to do if you would like to be entered into the contest!

First, FOLLOW my blog with either your WordPress account or by email address. (Right hand column under the photo there should be two buttons, one for following if you have an account and one for following via email.)

Second, LIKE our Facebook page.

Third, leave a comment on this post letting me know why you would love to win! Please leave your first name and last initial so that I can check the new likes on facebook to make sure that you match up! ğŸ™‚

ALL ENTRIES MUST BE RECEIVED BY WEDNESDAY NOVEMBER 4TH, 2015. WINNER WILL BE CHOSEN AND NOTIFIED AROUND 11/5/15-11/6/15.

Please feel free to share this post with your friends! ğŸ™‚

September 28th, 2015

These songs have been on repeat for me lately, and I would like to introduce you guys to some of my favorite songs that arenâ€™t on the radioâ€¦ yet!

Kip Moore, â€œRunning For Youâ€

â€œIf the light starts fading / Baby donâ€™t move / Just say my name, stay right there / Iâ€™ll come running for you.â€

If you havenâ€™t gotten Kipâ€™s sophomore album, Wild Ones, yetâ€¦ you are seriously missing out on some quality music. This album is so raw and full of so much passion that nearly every song gives me goosebumps. Iâ€™ve been a fan of Kip since 2011, before most people had any idea of who he was. Albeit the entire CD is on point, the song that I have to play twice every time that the album cycles through is track #12, Running For You. Written with Blair Daly and Troy Verges, Kip explains, â€œThe melody came to me I was with Troy Verges and Blair Daly, and I said, â€˜I got this thing.â€™ We just kinda wrote a song about when you really care about somebody, you wanna see â€™em shine and you wanna see â€™em go grab what theyâ€™re after.â€ Kipâ€¦ I hope one day some man sings (or plays) me this song when I pack up and head to Nashville after my own dreamsâ€¦

Old Dominion, â€œSnapbackâ€

â€œThose stars need to be wished on / Your skin needs to be kissed onâ€

I was literally hooked on this song from the first verseâ€¦ itâ€™s not your ordinary â€œTop 40â€ country songâ€¦ and that freshness and new sound is what is going to take it to the top. No doubt this song from their upcoming Meat and Candy album is going to reach #1. The upbeat and fun tempo and killer lyrics drew me in right away! My favorite line from the song? â€œWe got the beat, letâ€™s drop it.â€â€¦ just the way Matt sings it! This song makes me SMILE SO BIG! I just love a song that makes me break out in a huge grin! Snapback was written by Matthew Ramsey, Trevor Rosen and Brad Tursi, who are actually 3 of the 5 members of the band.

Kelsea Ballerini, â€œSecondhand Smokeâ€

â€œAm I the product of a problem that I couldnâ€™t change?/Got his eyes, got her hair, so do I get their mistakes?â€

This is the most powerful song on Kelseaâ€™s debut album, The First Time. I have been passionate about this song since I first got the CD in June. Secondhand Smoke is a deeply personal song for Kelsea, as it tells the story of her parents divorce. You can hear the raw emotion in every verse. She penned this tune with Josh Kerr and Jordyn Shellhart and they actually came up with the title for the song before the lyrics were written! â€œImmediately, I thought it could be a story of being in a household thatâ€™s broken and thatâ€™s all you know, but you decide that youâ€™re not going to feel like that,â€ Kelsea tells Rolling Stone. Kelsea hopes she can be a voice of comfort for kids who are going through a similar divorce situation like she did as a preteen.

Songs you should be listening to (and downloading!) right now:

Kip Moore, â€œIâ€™m to Blameâ€

Weâ€™ve been waiting for his new album for over a year nowâ€¦ his new single hit radio on February 2nd. Request it! Itâ€™s raw and honest and sexyâ€¦ bet you wonâ€™t be able to get the hook out of your head! Kip is one of my all time favorite artists and this song is so true to him and his personality.

Love & Theft, â€œWhiskey on my Breathâ€

Love & Theft is back with some amazing heart-felt and soul-filled harmonies. This song is GOLD. I have so much love for these two, and this is one of my favorite songs theyâ€™ve written so far! This song better get the praise and recognition that it deserves!

Sam Hunt, â€œTake Your Timeâ€

I could not be more obsessed with Sam Hunt. His acoustic mix tape (Behind the Pines) and debut album (Montavello) are consistently on repeat in my car. This is his newest radio single and is currently at #5 on the Billboard Hot Country Songs chart.

Old Dominion, â€œBreak up With Himâ€

Itâ€™s been a number 1 hit on Sirus XMâ€™s station, The Highway, but hasnâ€™t dropped to radio yet. Itâ€™s a fan favorite at their live shows and when I saw them live, itâ€™s the song that convinced me to buy their EP! Give it a listen!

Chase Bryant, â€œTake it on Backâ€

Country newcomer Chase Bryant is quickly making a name for himself. He is now on my â€œArtists I Want to See in Concertâ€ list! Lyrically, this song is like 90% of all the other bro-country songs out there, but itâ€™s catchy and is destined to be a radio hit.
